tit.e: Yoshitaka SENBON
Yoshitaka SENBON
Yoshitaka SENBON

sen.j: 千本 福隆（せんぼん よしたか、1854年6月19日（嘉永7年5月24日 (旧暦)） - 1918年（大正7年））は、師範学校高等師範学校・女子高等師範学校名誉教授。
sen.e: Yoshitaka SENBON (June 19, 1854 - 1918) is a professor emeritus at Tokyo Higher Normal School.
sen.cmt: 師範学校高等師範学校・女子高等師範学校名誉教授=東京高等師範学校名誉教授と判断しました。http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8D%83%E6%9C%AC%E7%A6%8F%E9%9A%86
sen.e: Yoshitaka SENBON (June 19, 1854 - 1918) is a professor emeritus at Tokyo Higher Normal School.
Yoshitaka SENBON (June 19, 1854 - 1918) is a professor emeritus at Tokyo Higher Normal School.

sen.j: 東京物理学講習所（後の東京物理学校、現在の東京理科大学）の創立者の一人である。
sen.e: He is one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics (later the Tokyo College of Science, current Tokyo University of Science).
He is one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics (later the Tokyo College of Science, current Tokyo University of Science).
He is one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics (later the Tokyo College of Science, current Tokyo University of Science).

tit.e: Career
Career
Career
In 1854: Born in Aichi.
In 1854: Born in Aichi.
In 1854: Born in Aichi.

tit.j: 1870年（明治3年）- 貢進生として、開成学校（後の東京大学）に入学。
tit.e: In 1870: Enrolled in Kaisei Gakko (Kaisei School, later The University of Tokyo) as a koushinsei (referral student from each domain).
tit.cmt: 貢進生：定訳不明です。 (referral student from each domainとしました。)
tit.e: In 1870: Enrolled in Kaisei Gakko (Kaisei School, later The University of Tokyo) as a koushinsei (referral student from each domain).
In 1870: Enrolled in Kaisei Gakko (Kaisei School, later The University of Tokyo) as a koushinsei (referral student from each domain).

tit.j: 1878年（明治11年）12月24日- 東京大学仏語物理学科第1期卒業。
tit.e: In December 24, 1878: Graduated from Department of French Physics, the University of Tokyo as a member of the inaugural class.
tit.cmt: 仏語物理学科：定訳不明です。第1期卒業：定訳不明です。
tit.e: In December 24, 1878: Graduated from the University of Tokyo as a member of the inaugural class of Department of Physics called "Department of French Physics," in which the lectures were given in French by a French instructor.

In December 24, 1878: Graduated from the University of Tokyo as a member of the inaugural class of Department of Physics called "Department of French Physics," in which the lectures were given in French by a French instructor.

tit.j: 1881年（明治14年）- 東京物理学講習所の創立者の一人となる。
tit.e: In 1881: Became one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics.
In 1881: Became one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics.
In 1881: Became one of the founders of the Tokyo Academy of Physics.

tit.j: 1885年（明治18年）- 東京物理学校維持同盟員となる。
tit.e: In 1885: Became a member of the association of preserving the Tokyo Academy of Physics.
tit.cmt: 維持同盟員：定訳不明です。
tit.e: In 1885: Became a member of the association of preservation of the Tokyo Academy of Physics.
In 1885: Became a member of the association of preservation of the Tokyo Academy of Physics.

tit.j: 1889年（明治22年）- 大日本教育会の師範学校小学校手工科取調委員となる。
tit.e: In 1889: Became a commissioner of investigating Department of Elementary School Manufacture Engineering, Normal School of the Educational Society of Japan.
tit.cmt: 小学校手工科：定訳不明です。手工科：Department of Elementary School Manufacture Engineeringとしました。
tit.e: In 1889: Became a committee member to investigate the Department of Elementary School Manual Production Training of Normal School in the Educational Society of Japan.
tit.cmt: Department of Elementary School Manufacture Engineering→Department of Elementary School Manual Production Trainingその他表現を見直しました。
tit.e: In 1889: Became a committee member to investigate the Department of Elementary School Manual Production Training of Normal School in the Educational Society of Japan.

sen.j: 上記のほか、文部省図書課の兼勤課員、高等師範学校（後の東京高等師範学校）教授を勤めた。
sen.e: In addition to above, he served as additional post officer of Archives Division, Ministry of Education, and professor of Higher Normal School (later Tokyo Higher Normal School).
sen.cmt: 兼勤課員：定訳不明です。図書課：定訳不明です。
sen.e: In addition to the above, he served as a temporary officer at Archives Division of Ministry of Education, and a professor of Higher Normal School (later Tokyo Higher Normal School).
sen.cmt: as additional post officer of Archives Division, Ministry of Education→as a temporary officer at Archives Division of Ministry of Educationprofessorに不定冠詞aを付与しました。
sen.e: In addition to the above, he served as a temporary officer at Archives Division of Ministry of Education, and a professor of Higher Normal School (later Tokyo Higher Normal School).

tit.e: Senbon Library
Senbon Library
Senbon Library

sen.j: 1919年（大正8年）6月に、東京高等師範学校（現在の筑波大学）へ千本の旧蔵書192冊が収められ、現在は千本文庫とよばれている。
sen.e: In June 1919, 192 books of Senbon's old possession were stored in Tokyo Higher Normal School (current University of Tsukuba) and now they are called Senbon Library.
In June 1919, 192 books of Senbon's old possession were stored in Tokyo Higher Normal School (current University of Tsukuba) and now they are called Senbon Library.
In June 1919, 192 books of Senbon's old possession were stored in Tokyo Higher Normal School (current University of Tsukuba) and now they are called Senbon Library.
